p01.title: A Runaway's Arrival
p01.text: A runaway teenager arrives in Philadelphia. Penniless. Unknown. He will invent America.

p02.title: The Self-Taught Scholar
p02.text: The candle maker's son had only two years of school. So he taught himself everything.

p03.title: Escape to Freedom
p03.text: At 17, he fled Boston. His brother's printing press. His father's plans. He chose his own future.

p04.title: Poor Richard's Wisdom
p04.text: Poor Richard said: 'Early to bed, early to rise.' Franklin became rich, famous, and wise.

p05.title: Taming Lightning
p05.text: A kite. A key. A thunderstorm. Franklin proved that lightning was electricity. Science changed forever.

p06.title: Ambassador to France
p06.text: The colonies needed France. France trusted no one. They sent Franklin—the only American Europe already loved.

p07.title: Victory and Crisis
p07.text: The war was won. The treaty signed. But the new nation was already falling apart.

p08.title: The Final Mission
p08.text: At 81, too weak to stand, Franklin was carried into the Constitutional Convention. His final mission.

p09.title: A Republic, If You Can Keep It
p09.text: Asked what they had created, Franklin said: 'A republic—if you can keep it.' The warning echoes still.

p10.title: The First American
p10.text: April 17, 1790. Franklin dies at 84. The runaway boy had invented himself—and helped invent a nation.
